column4: I would like to stay using Linux, but if it keeps like this, I will be forced to move back to windows..
another problem also...OpenOffice.org is really slow? will getting XFCE help?
0000:00:02.0 VGA compatible controller: Intel Corp. 82852/855GM Integrated Graphics Device (rev 02)
so... can my problem be solved?
ok.. I'm gonna try xubuntu.. busy installing it now.
but if it does not work, then I suppose I'll have to get rid of Linux for now...
hopefully it will work for me..
it runs... but just not that fast.. like loading apps takes long..
what other options have I got to read exec and word documents besides OpenOffice.Org?
and yes, openoffice is a memory hog
do they run better than openoffice?
I'm more an abiword/gnumeric guy, since I'm a gnome person. Koffice is for KDE, but you can try that as well.
you mean "excel", and no, since it's a word processor. Gnumeric is a spreadsheet.
and btw, I don't think you should be forced to move to xfce with your memory; try just changing the office programs first and see if that helps
as said, openoffice is probably the thing sucking up most of your memory :]
no, you can have them all installed at once if hd space is not an issue
